Instance.description: A drama node that represents a Multi Unit Event occurring on a Residential Rental Unit, occupied by a tenant.

Tunable.name: common_area_event
Tunable.description: When this flag is set to True, this event applies to the common area of the unit rather than the unit itself.

TunableVariant.name: contractor_picker_data
TunableVariant.description: The data for hire a contractor picker. You only need to tune it if it's a emergency type event.

Tunable.name: experienced_contractor_cost
Tunable.description: The cost of simoleons to hire a experienced contractor.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: The event icon in hire contractor picker.

Tunable.name: inexperienced_contractor_cost
Tunable.description: The cost of simoleons to hire a inexperienced contractor.

Tunable.name: name
Tunable.description: The event display name in hire contractor picker.

TunableVariant.name: event_type
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this represents the Multi Unit event type, and will be used to connect APM and MULE drama nodes.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The MultiUnitEventType enum representing the event type.

TunableList.name: failure_loots
TunableList.description: Loots that will be applied upon a failed event outcome, meaning the attempt to resolve it was not successful.

TunableList.name: fallback_loots
TunableList.description: If this event ends while the receiver household is inactive, these loots will be applied by the MultiUnitEventService once the household is active again.

TunableList.name: lapsed_loots
TunableList.description: Loots that will be applied if the event times out, meaning there was no attempt to resolve the issue.

TunableList.name: loots_on_schedule
TunableList.description: Loots that will be applied once this drama node is scheduled, meaning this event is now active on a rental unit.

Tunable.name: property_owner_event
Tunable.description: If this flag is set to True, this event is treated as an autonomous property management node. If this flag is set to False, this event is treated as a multi unit living events node.

Tunable.name: send_initial_outcome_telemetry
Tunable.description: Whether or not telemetry should be sent for this event drama node when the outcome is first set.

Tunable.name: start_in_any_relevant_unit
Tunable.description: If this flag is set to True and if the drama node has common_area_event set, if APM starts the event on any rental unit on the current lot it will start the event in the current zone regardless if the event belongs to the current unit or not.

Tunable.name: start_mu_situation
Tunable.description: If this flag is set to True, then the Multi Unit Event Service will start the situation when a tenant sim or property owner sim visits the rental unit.

TunableList.name: success_loots
TunableList.description: Loots that will be applied upon a successful event outcome, meaning the the attempt to resolve it was successful.

TunableList.name: unit_zone_modifiers
TunableList.description: A list of lot traits that may be applied if a Property Owner or Tenant of a rental unit loads into that zone, while the event for this unit is active.
